properties.name: camel.component.flatpack.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.flatpack.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.flatpack.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the flatpack component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.flatpack.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.allow-short-lines
properties.description: Allows for lines to be shorter than expected and ignores the extra characters

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.definition
properties.description: The flatpack pzmap configuration file. Can be omitted in simpler situations, but its preferred to use the pzmap.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.delimiter
properties.description: The delimiter char (could be ; , or similar)

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the flatpack data format. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.fixed
properties.description: Delimited or fixed. Is by default false = delimited

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.ignore-extra-columns
properties.description: Allows for lines to be longer than expected and ignores the extra characters.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.ignore-first-record
properties.description: Whether the first line is ignored for delimited files (for the column headers). Is by default true.

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.parser-factory-ref
properties.description: References to a custom parser factory to lookup in the registry

properties.name: camel.dataformat.flatpack.text-qualifier
properties.description: If the text is qualified with a character. Uses quote character by default.
